reviews.review: Need 3 more ppl for this game so we can do a full server of friends. You know you wanna play this shit.

Excellent PvE zombie FPS killing game thingy, similar to Left 4 Dead in concept but has enough nuances that separate it from L4D. A maximum of 6 people can participate, and you have a choice of 7 perks/classes which have different specializations in weapons, from automatic rifles to explosives, melee, et cetera. Instead of going from point A to B in L4D's campaign mode, Killing Floor is more or less the survival mode, where you have a bunch of waves of monsters that you mow down, and in between waves you spend your mysteriously obtained cash for better weapons.

Each specimen has their own unique properties to learn and exploit. It's lots of fun trying different things out on the stronger specimens - sharpshooters can pop scrakes and fleshpounds in the head with a crossbow, while berserkers can stun scrakes and kite fleshpounds to avoid them from charging the team. Your classes level up as you use their abilities, and there are 4 difficulty modes to keep you busy.

Wer ausversehen die cut Version gekauft hat kann es folgendermassen uncut machen:
---
Geht ins Verzeichnis "Steam\steamapps\common\killingfloor\System". Dann die Killingfloor.ini öffnen.

Unter "[Engine.Engine]" neue Zeile und bdevgoreoverride=True eintragen!
---

Definitely one of those must-play games. It's an action-packed survival Co-Op that requires both individual and teamwork skills to beat maps, especially at harder difficulties. You can't simply spam whole area with bullets (well, you might, but you won't last long) as you need to make proper use of your perk abilities (7 to choose from) and weapons (varying for each class) to clear ever-increasing waves of mutants (or zombies, if you prefer). Genuinely well-made maps and balanced weaponry seem only natural here.

The two downsides to this game are an abundance of DLCs and - at times - performance. Fortunately, nearly all of DLCs consist of character packs and only minority showcase new weapons. There are also reskin pack for weapons (golden and camo), but if you're not really into these things, they will only irk you. Performance is a big thing, though - if you have got an old(er) machine, you might find your KF dropping frames as hell, even on the lowest video settings.

Cutting long story short, I have to say Killing Floor is one of the best games I have ever played in my life, even despite its flaws - and by comparing to tonnes of fun it can give you, is really inexpensive.

Хорошая игра в режиме выживания, можно весело поиграть с друзьями, различное оружия как ближнего боя таки дальнего предостаточно, но к сожелению игра очень быстро вам надоест, играть в неё слишком долго невозможно. Некоторые карты отличные пародии на другие знаменитые игры вроде Portal. За полную стоимость покупать не стоит только во время скидок.

As far as zombie shooters go, it plays like a (slightly) more polished version of the Reign of the Undead mod for CoD4; that is, Nazi zombies with little-to-no defensive play. On the other hand, it can be buggy at times, especially in SP. I've had to wipe my stats more than once due to bugs that make the game unplayable. The core gameplay is good though, and there's plenty of custom maps and online servers to warrant buying it.

Fast paced survival horror, one of the best zombie co-op games I've ever played (to the point where I'm an addict now), fun variety of AI and playing on hell on earth with public randoms is quite challenging!  Never used to be a fan of melee weapons (unless its the chainsaw from the original doom!) or  claustrophobic up-close-and-personal AI but I certainly do enjoy playing support, demo and zerk and even watching hubby play it. That's 2 recommendations for KF! :)
